misc.plot_binary_heatmap(im, path)#
misc.neur_slice(neuron_type, nr_ex, nr_in)#

The setup: we put excitatory neurons in lists before inhibitory. This function returns relevant slices.

Parameters

  • neuron_type (NeuronTypes) – the type of neuron we need indices for.

  • nr_ex (int) – number of excitatory neurons.

  • nr_in (int) – number of inhibitory neurons.

Returns

a slice for the neurons of given type.

Return type

slice

misc.euclidian_dist_R2(p1, p2)#

Calculates the Eaclidian distance between two 2D points.

Parameters

  • p1 (tuple[float]) – coordinates of point 1.

  • p2 (tuple[float]) – coordinates of point 2.

Returns

the Euclidean distance between two 2D points.

Return type

float

misc.cust_range(*args, rtol=1e-05, atol=1e-08, include=[True, False])#

Code taken from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50299172/python-range-or-numpy-arange-with-end-limit-include

Combines numpy.arange and numpy.isclose to mimic open, half-open and closed intervals. Avoids also floating point rounding errors as with >>> numpy.arange(1, 1.3, 0.1) array([1. , 1.1, 1.2, 1.3])

args: [start, ]stop, [step, ]

as in numpy.arange

rtol, atol: floats

floating point tolerance as in numpy.isclose

include: boolean list-like, length 2

if start and end point are included

misc.crange(*args, **kwargs)#

Range excluding the end-point - from cust_range.

misc.orange(*args, **kwargs)#

Range including the end-point - from cust_range.
